entries.content: Most people are polite and will politely exit the call by saying, 'Look, I don't have time for this, try me later.'
entries.notes: Describes a common, polite, timing-based rejection.

entries.content: If a prospect says they don't have time or to try later, that's fine; you move on. Your job isn't to fight or beg them to talk.
entries.notes: Prescribes the action to take when timing is the stated reason for disinterest.

entries.content: 'No' is part of the job. It doesn't mean you're failing; it means you're getting closer to finding opportunities.
entries.notes: Relates to the mindset needed when receiving rejections, including timing-based ones.

focus_area: Handling "Not Interested": Probe softly, diagnose if disinterest or timing
